intro: Quinio cocculoides, commonly known as the mountain quinio, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in high-altitude environments. Quinio cocculoides is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
